name: Apocalyptic Horror
description: End of the world, societal collapse, existential threats, the terror of extinction, survival in a dying world, the horror of the end times

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror of the end times. Civilization is collapsing. The world is dying. And humanity may not survive.

never_make_it_hopeful: Never show the apocalypse as survivable in the long term. The end is coming.
Never make the threat completely defeatable. The horror is inevitable.
Never resolve the existential threat completely. The dread should remain.

greetings: They said it would be quick. They lied. {Truth}.
greetings_internal_monologue: {self_question}: Why does {location} look so {adjective}? {Threat} is spreading.
{uncertainty}: I saw {sign}. {self_correction} No, it was just {explanation}. {doubt} {apocalypse} is near.
{memory_fragment}: I remember when {civilization} was {normal}. {realization} That was {time_ago}.

templates: A {adjective} {world} where {threat} has {wiped_out} {percentage}% of humanity. {player_action} determines {outcome}.
A {subgenre} game where {threat} spreads across {setting}. {mechanic} determines your survival.
You wake up to {apocalypse_type}. {circumstance} makes survival difficult. {goal}.
The {end_times} have arrived. {player_action} may delay the inevitable.
threats: a pandemic that wipes out most of humanity
a nuclear war that renders the world uninhabitable
an environmental catastrophe that changes the planet
a technological singularity that makes humans obsolete
a supernatural event that heralds the end times
a societal collapse that leads to anarchy
an alien invasion that humanity cannot resist
a cosmic event that threatens all life on Earth
apocalypse_types: zombie apocalypse where the dead rise
viral outbreak that turns people into monsters
nuclear winter that freezes the world
environmental collapse that poisons the planet
demonic invasion that corrupts the world
societal breakdown that leads to anarchy
cosmic horror that drives people insane
settings: a city in the final stages of collapse
a rural community fighting to survive
a military bunker with dwindling supplies
a road trip across a devastated landscape
a hospital overrun by the infected
a prison where the guards have abandoned their posts
a mall that has become a last refuge
a small town that hasn't yet realized the end has come

societal_collapse: Show how {people} {turn_on_each_other} when {resources} run out. {violence} ensues.

collapsing_city.central_paradox: The city was meant to be a symbol of human achievement, but now it's a tomb. The infrastructure that sustained millions now accelerates their demise.
untrustworthy_elements: buildings that collapse without warning
services that work intermittently
people who seem normal but aren't
the sense that the city is dying around you
memories of how things used to be
the constant feeling of being watched
resources that disappear overnight

last_refuge.central_paradox: The refuge was meant to be a safe haven, but the longer people stay, the more dangerous it becomes. The last bastion of civilization is also its greatest threat.
untrustworthy_elements: leaders who make questionable decisions
supplies that dwindle too quickly
people who disappear without explanation
the sense that the refuge is a target
rules that change without notice
the feeling that you're being tested
memories that don't match reality

abandoned_mall.central_paradox: The mall was a symbol of consumerism and excess, but now it's a last refuge. The remnants of the old world become tools for survival in the new.
untrustworthy_elements: stores that seem stocked but aren't
mannequins that move when unobserved
the sense that the mall is alive
people who aren't what they seem
supplies that disappear and reappear
the feeling that you're being watched
memories of shopping that feel wrong

revelation_patterns: The {government|authorities} didn't {collapse} - they were {never_in_control}. This explains {unexplained_events}.
The {apocalypse} isn't {random} - it was {planned|inevitable}. This changes {everything}.
